context: I took credit for your work
letters:
Dear [Colleague's Name],

I hope this message finds you well. I am writing to sincerely apologize for the oversight I made regarding the recent project presentation. Upon reflection, I realize that I unintentionally took credit for your contributions, which were vital to our team's success. 

I deeply regret this misrepresentation, and I understand how it can affect your reputation and feelings of recognition within the team. Your hard work and creativity were instrumental in achieving our goals, and it was never my intention to undermine your efforts. 

Moving forward, I am committed to ensuring you receive the acknowledgment you deserve. I would like to discuss how I can better support you and highlight your contributions in future projects. Thank you for your understanding, and I hope we can continue to work together positively.

Sincerely,  
[Your Name]
